lameonj.encoder.std

Interface StreamEncoder

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Encoder
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    StreamEncoderImpl, StreamEncoderPCMImpl, StreamEncoderWAVImpl

    public interface StreamEncoder
extends Encoder
    This interface may be used to encode the specified source file or stream to MP3 with only one call or progressively by chunks.

    LAME flags must be set up before starting an encoding task. If the source file or stream is a WAV the header is used to set up the LAME encoder with the number of channels and sample rate. If PCM the encoder uses the default values of LAME. Call the Encoder.getEncoderConfig() method to config any other encoding parameters (or to overwrite the defaults).

    If the source audio is stereo the PCM data must be interleaved.

    See Also:
    LAMEOnJStdEncoder.createStreamEncoder(String), LAMEOnJStdEncoder.createStreamEncoder(InputStream,String)

    • Method Detail

      • getSourceInputStream

        java.io.InputStream getSourceInputStream()
        Returns the input stream used to encode.
        Returns:
        the input stream.

      • encode

        void encode(java.lang.String mp3File)
        Encodes the input source to MP3 saving to the specified file.

        If VBR Info tag is set (see Lame.lame_set_bWriteVbrTag(lame_global_flags,int)) is automatically added.

        The encoder is closed.

        Parameters:
        mp3File - the MP3 file path.

      • encode

        void encode(java.io.OutputStream mp3Stream)
        Encodes the input source to MP3 saving to the specified stream.

        The encoder is not closed but no new encoding can be done. The encoder must be closed explicitly (see Encoder.close()).

        VBR Info tag is not added, you can use the method Encoder.writeVbrTag(String)

        Parameters:
        mp3Stream - the MP3 putput stream.

      • initEncoding

        int initEncoding()
        Starts a progressive encoding process.

        The required size of the target MP3 byte buffer is returned

        Returns:
        pcmBufferSize the required MP3 buffer size.
        See Also:
        encodeBuffer(byte[])

      • encodeBuffer

        int encodeBuffer(byte[] mp3Buffer)
        Encodes a chunk of PCM data read from the input source.

        MP3 buffer must have the length provided by the method initEncoding()

        Parameters:
        mp3Buffer - the MP3 buffer to fill with the encoded MP3 audio.
        Returns:
        the number of bytes used to fill the MP3 buffer. If 0 the encoding process is finished.
